Assertion: CTA count above-fold <= 2
Pass_Criteria: Count CTA buttons visible in viewport (1024px height): pass if <= 2
Fail_Criteria: CTA count > 2 OR competing CTAs with equal visual weight
Metric: Conversion Rate, Time to First Click
Notes: Count only primary CTA-styled buttons. Text links don't count. Include sticky header CTAs.

Assertion: CTA height >= 48px AND touch target >= 44x44px AND contrast >= 4.5:1
Pass_Criteria: Measure: button height >= 48px CSS / touch target area >= 44x44px / contrast ratio via WCAG tool
Fail_Criteria: Button < 48px height OR touch target < 44x44px OR contrast < 4.5:1
Notes: Use Chrome DevTools computed styles. Test contrast with WebAIM checker. Mobile: test actual touch target area.

Assertion: Above-fold contains: 1 headline + 1 CTA + 1 visual
Pass_Criteria: Check viewport (375px mobile / 1024px desktop): must contain value proposition headline + 1 clear CTA + supporting visual
Fail_Criteria: Missing headline OR missing CTA OR above-fold is blank/loading
Notes: Test at both 375px and 1024px viewport. Above-fold = content visible without scrolling.

Assertion: Logo top-left AND nav top/right AND footer standard
Pass_Criteria: Logo clickable at top-left. Nav at top or top-right. Footer contains: links / copyright / contact
Fail_Criteria: Logo not top-left OR nav in unexpected position OR no footer
Notes: Exceptions: full-screen landing pages may hide nav. Document if intentional deviation.

Assertion: Form > 3 fields has progress indicator showing step X/Y
Pass_Criteria: Progress bar or step indicator visible. Shows current step / total. Visual advancement on step completion.
Fail_Criteria: Form > 3 fields with no progress indicator OR indicator not updating
Metric: Form Completion Rate, Drop-off per Step
Notes: Test form progression. Verify indicator updates on each step. Check mobile layout.

Assertion: Top-level nav items <= 9 AND grouping if > 7
Pass_Criteria: Count top-level nav items. If > 7: verify grouping (dropdown/mega menu). Test at all breakpoints.
Fail_Criteria: Top-level items > 9 OR > 7 items without grouping mechanism
Notes: Count only visible top-level items. Dropdown children don't count toward limit.

Assertion: Related elements spacing < 50% of unrelated elements spacing
Pass_Criteria: Measure: intra-group gap <= 16px while inter-group gap >= 32px (or equivalent ratio)
Fail_Criteria: Uniform spacing everywhere OR related items farther than unrelated
Notes: Use CSS gap/margin/padding measurements. Compare spacing within section vs between sections.

Assertion: Same action = same style across all pages AND single icon library
Pass_Criteria: Audit: primary buttons identical everywhere. Secondary buttons identical. Icons from 1 library. Spacing follows base unit.
Fail_Criteria: Mixed button styles for same action OR multiple icon libraries OR inconsistent spacing base
Notes: Create style inventory. Compare buttons/links/icons across >= 5 pages. Check design tokens consistency.

Assertion: Key info/actions at position 1 AND last in any list/nav
Pass_Criteria: Audit nav: most important items first and last. Audit feature lists: key benefits at positions 1 and N.
Fail_Criteria: Important items buried in middle positions only
Notes: Check heatmap data if available. Primary nav items should be at edges.

Assertion: Form accepts >= 2 formats AND inline validation AND specific errors
Pass_Criteria: Test: phone accepts (0901234567 AND +84901234567). Date accepts (01/15/2025 AND 2025-01-15). Error messages specific.
Fail_Criteria: Form rejects valid alternate formats OR only generic errors OR no inline validation
Notes: Test edge cases: spaces in phone numbers / different date formats / email with + sign.

Assertion: All interactive elements >= 44x44px AND primary actions in bottom 40%
Pass_Criteria: Measure all buttons/links/toggles. Touch target >= 44x44px (including padding). Primary CTA in bottom zone.
Fail_Criteria: Any interactive element < 44x44px OR primary action in top 20% of screen
Notes: Test on actual devices. Account for status bar / notch. Test landscape orientation too.

Assertion: Loading indicator < 400ms AND skeleton screens for loads > 1s
Pass_Criteria: Measure: time from action to loading indicator visible. Skeleton screens for API calls > 1s. Progress for > 3s.
Fail_Criteria: Blank screen > 400ms after action OR no skeleton for slow content
Notes: Use performance profiler. Test on mid-range device (not just high-end). Test poor network (3G Slow).

Assertion: Related content in visual container AND main nav uses bottom tabs <= 5
Pass_Criteria: Verify: cards group related info. Bottom tab bar for main sections (<= 5 tabs). Distinct visual boundaries.
Fail_Criteria: Related content not visually grouped OR > 5 bottom tabs OR no clear boundaries
Notes: Common pattern: 3-5 bottom tabs. Each tab = distinct section. Active tab clearly highlighted.

Assertion: Border-radius / shadow / spacing consistent AND animations ease-out
Pass_Criteria: Audit: border-radius same across cards (e.g. all 12px). Shadows same depth per elevation. Animations use ease-out.
Fail_Criteria: Mixed border-radius values OR inconsistent shadows OR linear/abrupt animations
Notes: Export design tokens. Check for consistency. Animation curves: prefer ease-out for element entry.

Assertion: Key flows end with success screen + positive messaging
Pass_Criteria: Test: signup -> success screen. Checkout -> confirmation. Form submit -> thank you. Each with positive copy.
Fail_Criteria: Flow ends abruptly (back to home) OR no confirmation screen OR negative/neutral messaging
Notes: Each success screen should have: positive headline + next action suggestion + share option (optional).

Assertion: Icon style uniform AND color coding consistent
Pass_Criteria: All icons same style (all filled OR all outlined OR all pixel). Item categories: same color = same type.
Fail_Criteria: Mixed icon styles OR same color used for different item types
Notes: Audit entire icon set. Create icon style guide. Test colorblind accessibility.

Assertion: HUD <= 15% screen AND matches art direction
Pass_Criteria: Measure HUD pixel area / total screen area. Visual style matches game art (not generic UI).
Fail_Criteria: HUD > 20% screen area OR HUD style clashes with game aesthetic
Notes: Measure at multiple resolutions. Account for transparent HUD areas. Test with actual gameplay footage.

Assertion: Important items have >= 2 visual differentiators
Pass_Criteria: Verify: rare/special items differ by (color + size) OR (color + animation) OR (size + glow). Test recognition speed.
Fail_Criteria: Special items look same as common items OR only 1 differentiator
Notes: Test with 5 users: can they spot the special item in < 2 seconds? If not -> fail.

Assertion: Menu options <= 8 AND accessible in <= 2 interactions
Pass_Criteria: Count options per menu level <= 8. Test: menu open -> select option in <= 2 taps/clicks. Test during gameplay.
Fail_Criteria: > 8 options per level OR requires > 2 interactions to reach common action
Notes: Critical: test DURING active gameplay. Menu should not break immersion. Consider radial/wheel menus.

Assertion: HUD clusters at screen edges AND inter-cluster spacing >= 40px
Pass_Criteria: Health cluster top-left. Minimap corner. Action bar bottom. Each cluster separated by >= 40px clear space.
Fail_Criteria: HUD scattered randomly OR clusters touching/overlapping OR center-screen HUD blocking view
Notes: Measure on target resolution. Ensure >= 60% center screen clear for gameplay view.

Assertion: Default view <= 7 key metrics AND drill-down on interaction
Pass_Criteria: Count visible metrics on default load <= 7. Each metric clickable for detail. Progressive disclosure implemented.
Fail_Criteria: Default shows > 12 metrics OR no drill-down capability OR all data at same level
Notes: KPI cards: max 4-6 on first row. Supporting charts below. Detail on click/hover.

Assertion: Charts use 2D AND data labels present AND minimal chartjunk
Pass_Criteria: All charts 2D (unless spatial data). Clear labels. No decorative gradients. Clean gridlines.
Fail_Criteria: 3D charts for non-spatial data OR missing data labels OR excessive decoration
Notes: Exception: 3D justified for geographic/spatial data. Document justification.

Assertion: Filters visible without scroll AND active filters shown AND fade on filter
Pass_Criteria: Filter bar in viewport. Applied filters as tags/pills. Filtered-out data dimmed (not hidden) initially.
Fail_Criteria: Filters below fold OR active filters not visible OR no visual distinction on filtered data
Metric: Data Discovery Speed, Filter Usage Rate
Notes: Test: apply filter -> verify visual feedback. Remove filter -> verify reset. Test with multiple active filters.

Assertion: Onboarding has progress AND auto-save AND resume
Pass_Criteria: Progress bar/checklist with %. Auto-save draft every 30s. On return: show 'Continue where you left off'.
Fail_Criteria: No progress indicator OR lost data on browser close OR no resume capability
Metric: Onboarding Completion Rate, Time to Activate
Notes: Test: close browser mid-onboarding -> reopen -> verify state preserved.

Assertion: Advanced options hidden AND smart defaults AND auto-detect
Pass_Criteria: Basic mode: pre-filled smart defaults. 'Advanced' toggle reveals power options. Auto-detect timezone/language/etc.
Fail_Criteria: All settings exposed upfront OR no defaults OR manual config required for basic setup
Notes: Test as brand-new user. Measure: account creation -> first value moment. Should be < 5 minutes.

Assertion: Each screen 1 primary action AND no redundant paths
Pass_Criteria: Audit each screen: identify primary action. Should be visually dominant. No duplicate CTAs for same action.
Fail_Criteria: Screen has 3+ equal-weight CTAs OR multiple paths to identical action
Notes: Map user flows. Each screen = 1 job. Primary CTA = 1 clear next step.

Assertion: Core task completable without docs AND undo for destructive actions
Pass_Criteria: Test: new user -> complete core task without help docs. All destructive actions have undo (7s window minimum).
Fail_Criteria: Must read docs/tutorial to use basic feature OR no undo for delete/archive
Notes: 5-second test: can user identify what to do first? If confused -> fail.

Assertion: Cart indicator always visible AND recently viewed AND comparison <= 4
Pass_Criteria: Cart badge (item count) in persistent header. 'Recently Viewed' section accessible. Compare feature <= 4 items.
Fail_Criteria: Cart hidden behind menu OR no recently viewed OR comparison allows > 5 items
Metric: Cart Abandonment Rate, Return Visit Rate
Notes: Cart badge should update in real-time (optimistic UI). Recently viewed: last 10-20 items.

Assertion: Products <= 24/page AND faceted filters AND sort >= 3 options AND recommendations
Pass_Criteria: Count products per page. Verify filter sidebar/bar. Sort: price/rating/new/popular. Recommended section present.
Fail_Criteria: Products > 50/page without pagination OR no filters OR no sort options
Notes: Infinite scroll OK if virtualized + filter persistent. Test filter combinations.

Assertion: Checkout follows Cart -> Shipping -> Payment -> Confirm
Pass_Criteria: Map checkout steps. Verify sequential flow. Standard icons (cart/lock/check). Progress indicator present.
Fail_Criteria: Non-sequential checkout OR confusing step order OR missing security indicators
Notes: Include guest checkout option. Show order summary at each step. Security badges at payment step.

Assertion: Mobile >= 48px / Tablet >= 44px / Desktop >= 36px targets
Pass_Criteria: Test at each breakpoint: 375px -> targets 48px. 768px -> targets 44px. 1024px+ -> targets 36px.
Fail_Criteria: Any target below threshold at corresponding breakpoint
Notes: Use browser DevTools device emulation + real devices. Test both portrait and landscape.

Assertion: Mobile: hamburger/bottom nav AND Desktop: full nav AND breakpoints 375/768/1024/1440
Pass_Criteria: Verify nav transformation at each breakpoint. Mobile -> hamburger OR bottom tabs. Desktop -> full visible nav.
Fail_Criteria: Same nav forced on all breakpoints OR nav broken at any breakpoint
Notes: Test nav transition animation. Verify no layout shift on breakpoint change.

Assertion: Mobile shows priority content AND hides non-essential AND lazy loads
Pass_Criteria: Mobile viewport: verify critical content visible. Non-essential collapsed (accordion) or hidden. Images lazy-loaded.
Fail_Criteria: Desktop content crammed into mobile OR no content prioritization OR all images eager-loaded
Notes: Lighthouse mobile score >= 80. Test on 3G Slow throttling. Content priority matches user intent.

Assertion: Main nav <= 5 AND booking <= 3 steps AND emergency always visible
Pass_Criteria: Count nav items. Map booking flow steps. Verify emergency button visible on every screen.
Fail_Criteria: Nav > 5 items OR booking > 5 steps OR emergency hidden behind menu
Metric: Task Completion Time, Emergency Access Speed
Notes: Emergency button: red / always top-right or floating. Booking: select provider -> date -> confirm.

Assertion: Account overview default AND standard layout AND security visible
Pass_Criteria: App opens to account overview. Transactions list standard. Security indicators (lock/https/verified) on all screens.
Fail_Criteria: Non-standard entry screen OR missing security indicators OR unfamiliar financial patterns
Notes: Test: first-time open -> can user find balance in < 3 seconds? If not -> fail.

Assertion: Serif heading AND whitespace >= 40% AND animations 300-500ms AND 2x images
Pass_Criteria: Verify: heading font = serif. Measure whitespace ratio. Animation timing. Image resolution >= 2x device pixel ratio.
Fail_Criteria: System font for headings OR cramped layout < 25% whitespace OR jarring fast animations OR low-res images
Metric: Brand Perception Score, Time on Site
Notes: Premium feel requires: slow transitions / generous space / high-quality assets. No shortcuts.
